page.title: 18Gnosall Carnival
page.content: Gnosall Carnival is held once a year around June. A parade of floats and people in fancy dress parade from the Oak public house to St. Lawrence school grounds, where the competition for the best float is held. In St. Lawrence school grounds there are fairground rides and mini train rides around the school playground. In the centre of the school playground there is a pram race and dancing. There is a refreshment tent and many other stalls and games. Many village organisations are involved, including the St. John's Ambulance Brigade, the Mothers' Union, local churches and school P.T.A.'s and local businesses. The carnival involves people in a lot of hard work but it is all worthwhile because it brings the whole community together to enjoy themselves and raises money for St. Lawrence's Restoration.
